conclusion: To determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the path of the liquid from each source (A, B, and C) and how it interacts with the baffles.
The liquid from A is yellow.
The liquid from A flows downwards and hits the orange baffle.
The orange baffle directs the liquid from A towards the red baffle.
The red baffle further directs the liquid from A towards the brown baffle.
The brown baffle directs the liquid from A towards container D.
The liquid from B is blue.
The liquid from B flows downwards and hits the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle directs the liquid from B towards the gray baffle.
The gray baffle directs the liquid from B towards container E.
The liquid from C is orange.
The liquid from C flows downwards and hits the gray baffle.
The gray baffle directs the liquid from C towards container E.
The liquid from A flows into container D.
The liquid from B flows into container E.
The liquid from C flows into container E.
